div.p: ONLINE USER 1: What about older people, I'm gonna add older people to my list. I mean, when you're young, you can drink a lot more, but when you're old, there's no way.
ONLINE USER 2: Older people?! No, I think everybody would say criminals, cause, they're in jail for a reason.

ONLINE USER 3: Yeah, I would definitely agree with that. What about celebrities though? I mean, they've got all that money, people throwing them drinks all the time, you're bound to get alcoholism that way.
ANTONIO: So what you think about the list of words? Does it surprise you?
MICHELLE: Not at all. It makes sense most people to believe this is the kind of person who develops alcoholism or drug addiction.
ANTONIO: Because of stereotypes they've seen or heard?
MICHELLE: Yeah, and because of they've own experiences. For example, say I have a friend, and her mom and grandfather both have alcoholism, and then starts to have problems with her own drinking.
MICHELLE: It feels like, to me, she's just living out a family tradition.

MICHELLE: Or, here's another one. Say a person says they'll only have one or two drinks, but then they end up closing down the bar. Or once they open a bottle, they finish it. It feels like they're weak, or have no self control.
ANTONIO: Okay, so it makes sense that people would have these beliefs, but why does it matter?
MICHELLE: Well, it matters for a couple reasons and it really revolves around our choices. First off, how many of us would look at that list and say, "yeah, that's me."
INTERNET DATER: Ugh, look at this guy, Ladiesman123. Weak, depressed loser with no self-esteem. Is he for real?
ANTONIO: Yeah, there aren't many people who'd say they are a weak, depressed, loser with low-self esteem.
MICHELLE: Right, so if I don't see myself on the list, I may feel like I don't need to worry. My choices don't matter.
ANTONIO: Since so many people believe this list is true, there must be some accuracy to it, right?
MICHELLE: Right, to check out if it's accurate or not, we need to look at one more question: "Is alcoholism and drug addiction caused by the kind of person I am or by the kind of choices I make?"
